entry.title: What Does It Mean for AI to Understand?
entry.content: It’s simple enough for AI to seem to comprehend data, but devising a true test of a machine’s knowledge has proved difficult.

entry.title: AI Researchers Fight Noise by Turning to Biology
entry.content: Tiny amounts of artificial noise can fool neural networks, but not humans. Some researchers are looking to neuroscience for a fix.

entry.title: Researchers Defeat Randomness to Create Ideal Code
entry.content: By carefully constructing a multidimensional and well-connected graph, a team of researchers has finally created a long-sought locally testable code that can immediately betray whether it’s been corrupted.

entry.title: How Quantum Computers Will Correct Their Errors
entry.content: Quantum bits are fussy and fragile. Useful quantum computers will need to use an error-correction technique like the one that was recently demonstrated on a real machine.
